I'm working on writing some examples in C++, and I'm not sure how to
work with PureFluids.  I have two questions.

First, I'm not quite sure how to initialize a pure fluid from an XML
or CTI file in C++.  For example, I want to write something that would
do the equivalent of the following MATLAB code
%%%
% water = importPhase('liquidvapor.xml','water');
% set(water,'T',Tmin,'P',Pmin);
%%%

Second, I've noticed that in my cantera install directory the file
lib/kernel/PureFluidPhase.h tries to include two files which do not
exist in the cantera install dir
#include "../../ext/tpx/Sub.h"
#include "../../ext/tpx/utils.h"
For now I've just copied these two .h files to the appropriate place
in my install directory, but what should the structure really be?  

As always, I really appreciate everyone's help, particularly Dave
Goodwin for being generous with his time and patience!

Thanks,
Rebecca
